data.title: City of Eugene Neighborhoods
data.meta_description: Map and information on City of Eugene neighborhoods
data.text:
This map contains links to Eugene’s neighborhood associations. Click on any area to see contact information for the respective neighborhood association. If you are not sure of which neighborhood association your address belongs to, use the search function in the map to find it.

Click here to open the map in full screen

Get Involved

Neighborhood associations are volunteer organizations that thrive and grow when everyone is involved. Here are just a few of the ways you can get involved in your neighborhood:

Attend a neighborhood association event or meeting, read the newsletter or check out the neighborhood association’s website

Contribute to your neighborhood association newsletter or website

Improve neighborhood safety by organizing a Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) or neighborhood watch group

Play an active role in responding to and preventing acts of hate or bias in the neighborhood (see Hate & Bias Prevention & Response Toolkit)

Organize your neighbors and apply for a matching grant

Join the board of your neighborhood association or serve on a committee

Volunteer at a neighborhood event such as a picnic, potluck or neighborhood clean-up

Get in touch with neighborhood association leaders

Mouse over "Neighborhood associations" on the menu tot he left to find a page for each of the active associations in Eugene or download a list of current neighborhood association leaders by clicking here.
